--- title: "1.10 — The Hecksher-Olin Model: Empirics — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance="minimal"} # Meeting Date *Thursday, February 23, 2023* ::: ::: callout-warning # Upcoming Assignment [Problem Set 1](/assignment/01-problem-set) (1.1-1.8) is due by 11:59 PM Thursday February 23 on Blackboard Assignments. ::: ## Overview Today, we cover the empirical findings and tests of the Hecksher-Ohlin model. ## Readings - Chapter 4.2 in Feenstra & Taylor ### Primary Sources Mentioned: - [ Leontief (1953), “Domestic Production and Foreign Trade; The American Capital Position Re-Examined”](/files/readings/Leontief-1953.pdf) - [ Bowen, Leamer, and Sveikauskas (1987), “Multicountry, Multifactor Tests of Factor Abundance Theory”](/files/readings/Bowen-1987.pdf) - [ Trefler (1995), “The Case of the Missing Trade and Other Mysteries”](/files/readings/Trefler-1995.pdf) ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF

## Assignments ### Problem Set 1 Due Thursday February 23 [Problem Set 1](/assignment/01-problem-set) (1.1-1.8) is due by 11:59 PM Thursday February 23 on Blackboard Assignments.
